lines.text: Most men don't enjoy taking money from women.
That's the best kind. It's the hardest to get and always smells so good.
Stay down or I'll kick your head right out the window.
I've seen so many women cry it doesn't impress me anymore.
[first lines]
Do all the railways in Peru have to go this fast?
We're trying to get you back to Cusco in time to catch your plane. Don't worry, we've never lost a tourist yet.
It's been very enjoyable. I've enjoyed the trip.
You're wondering how you're going to pay me without hurting my feelings, Miss Morris, forget it. Just, uh, take out your roll and start counting.
You're not exactly timid, are you?
Not about money. Money sings and I love music.
Any private planes due in?
No. You always ask if any private planes is due in and the answer is always no.
Well, someday the answer will be yes.
Then what? Supposing a private plane does come in?
Just between you and me, I'll steal it.
Where did Morgan say he'd meet me?
The old grotto. Better stay away from that crud.
I like being around Morgan. Makes me feel honest.
Mr. Steele, Harry Steele?
Well, does the name really matter?
Yes, because my name is Steele, and I'm bigger than you are.

[to Harry Steele]
For a tall man, you're the smallest man I ever met.

[to Miss Morris]
A girl like you, you're made for somebody like me, and you know it.
